meanings.definition: A sea animal with a soft body and eight long arms.
meanings.sent1: The octopus swam gracefully through the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I saw an octopus at the aquarium last week.
meanings.sent3: The octopus tried to juggle all its tasks but ended up dropping everything.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an octopus, reaching out in different directions at once.
meanings.sent5: The octopus changed colors to blend in with its surroundings, like a master of disguise.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has many different parts or aspects.
meanings.sent1: The project was an octopus, with various departments working together.
meanings.sent2: Her schedule was like an octopus, with meetings and appointments in every direction.
meanings.sent3: The octopus of responsibilities on his plate seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent4: The city was an octopus, with its roads stretching out in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The octopus of ideas in her mind seemed to intertwine and connect in unexpected ways.
